intro: Hieracium leptoprenanthes, commonly known as the slenderleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its ecological role and aesthetic value, it is often found in native plant gardens and conservation areas.
